message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC 

This paper deals with decision-theoretic online learning, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of machine learning. Specifically, the paper focuses on a variant of the sleeping experts problem, which is a well-studied problem in the field of online learning. The paper presents new algorithms that obtain optimal regret bounds, which suggests that it is likely to be categorized under machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper involves the analysis of upper and lower bounds, which is a common theme in theoretical computer science (cs.CC) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper deals with algorithms and computational efficiency, which suggests that it could also be categorized under data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
